page.title: 11Framlingham Mere
page.content: Framlingham Mere is a lake beside the castle, probably created by digging out the soil which is now the castle mound. It used to be much bigger,but it is still a good place for seeing many forms of wildlife. It has reeds and small islands. There are many breeds of birds,altogether we have seen 52 different kinds including cormorant, muscovy duck, shellduck and a barn owl. The animals consist mainly of rabbits, mice, voles, shrews and hedgehogs. You see amphibians around the streams maybe even the crested newt. In the River Ore flowing in and out of the Mere there re feshwater fish, stoneloach, minnow and sticklebacks. There is much pond life such as shrimps,beetles and larvae of many kinds. Nearby is a wood with bluebells. The trees are oak,willow elder and hawthorn. In the hedgerows you may find blackberry,rosehips, etc.
